main event: On September 16, 1959, a cigar-shaped object was observed in Toledo, Ohio, exhibiting unusual circular motion.
interesting points: The object was stationary for 10 to 15 seconds before moving at unusual circular motion,The sighting lasted approximately 1 to 2 minutes,The object is described as small and white,There are comments that it might have been a reflection or satellite, but not enough information to identify it definitively, The report includes references to a previous sighting on September 8, 1958, where the object appeared to leave a white trail.
witness description: neighborhood children brought attention to the sighting
